intro: Gymnostephium gracile, commonly known as the slender gymnostephium, is a small evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Theaceae, which includes camellias and other ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical gardens.
